transcripts.text: Hi folks, I'm Steve Hindy for Showing Animals Respect and Kindness.  This is an update to the case of an individual who made repeated obscene and threatening phone calls to us because he's unhappy with the crushed cockfighting campaign of Shark and the Humane Farming Association.
If you want to keep living, shut your fucking mouth.  If you don't want to continue living, keep talking.

That individual, now identified as Jeremy Carrion of Laura Hills, North Carolina, has been charged with three counts of threatening to kill, which are felonies, and ten counts of obscene language, which are misdemeanors.

How about you come on up to Chi-town, you motherfucker?  Goddamn, you won't make it back, you son of a bitch.  This is things people say.  When they don't shut their mouth, but it's too late.  Please stop.  I won't do it anymore.  Please don't.  Please stop.  Please.  No, I won't do it anymore.

Jeremy Carrion is quite a representative of the cockfighting fraternity.  When he was called by a Kane County Sheriff's deputy regarding his unlawful behavior, Carrion treated the officer pretty much the same as when he called me.  The police report states that Mr.  Carrion used racist, threatening, obscene language.

The report includes, For approximately four minutes I listened to him.  I tried to tell him who I was and my reason for calling.  but he told me to go fuck myself.  I'd begin to talk again, and every time I would talk, he'd say, fuck you.  I did recognize his voice to be the same as the one in the recording.

The Federal Bureau of Investigations, or the FBI, has also been informed about this matter, so now law enforcement is aware of Mr.  Carrion on both a state and federal level, and as I mentioned, there are now warrants out for his arrest.  What Mr.  Carrion did was disgusting enough, but there's even more to this story.  To cover for his behavior, Carrion told police that I made racist remarks during a supposed conversation with him.  This is an absolute lie, because I never had a conversation with Mr.  Carrion, and that can be proven.  The police can tell how many phone calls were made and whether there was a conversation.
